data.title: AY HEL Schengen Lounge from 09JUL24
data.meta_description: Finnair | Finnair Plus - AY HEL Schengen Lounge from 09JUL24 - Originally Posted by NoWindowSeat Its clear Finnair went all in scandic again what comes to the catering in the new lounge(s). If possible, it is even worse than before, at least on the opening day as not even pepper/shriracha etc. available to add some
data.text:
Jul 14, 2024, 6:04 am

Join Date: Sep 2011

Location: London

Programs: BA Gold

Posts: 1,489

Quote:

Originally Posted by NoWindowSeat

Its clear Finnair went all in scandic again what comes to the catering in the new lounge(s). If possible, it is even worse than before, at least on the opening day as not even pepper/shriracha etc. available to add some taste to the school cafeteria food. The space itself is nice, though.

In the whole Finnair eco system, theres one classy thing/place alive, the platwing, and even there the opening times are screaming cost savings all over.

All other lounges are cheap, everything up in the air is cheap, theres just no other way to put it.

I am sure they plan for the pleasant visuals to distract passengers from the cheapness around them.

OT: Aspire lounges

The new Aspire lounge at the gate 21 will open at the turn of the year and the old Aspire lounge will be renovated by next summer (source: matkaviikko.net)

New lounge looks nice, but the food is still horrible! Drinks are good, but not all can enjoy them on a business trip in the morning.

​​​​​​Food wise I'll stick with Pier Zero, and go to AY lounge just for drinks when possible.

Jul 22, 2024, 4:23 am

Join Date: Mar 2013

Location: Sydney, Australia

Programs: BA Gold, QF Platinum, SQ Silver

Posts: 369

In the new Platinum corner of the Schengen lounge as we speak. Plenty of pictures have been posted already so I wont bother- it looks exactly like in all the pics floating around, would not call this clinical at all, rather what youd expect from modern clean and uncluttered Scandinavian design. Very nice in my view.

Overall, this is such a HUGE improvement over the old lounge (and unlike claimed by many online bloggers NOT in the old space as that has gotten gutted out and is clearly visible empty from the terminal). Last year, I had connected in the Schengen area for the first time and was only used to the great non-Schengen lounge so the messy old Schengen lounge had been a real shock to me. This is so much better, much nicer space, great tarmac views and just overall much quieter and more spacious with nice clean toilets and plenty of different seating options to satisfy anyones needs. Granted, the food is still not great but the one hot pasta with salami dish was still way better than rye god awful creamy pasta with cod and salmon dish that they had last year in the old lounge and has haunted my worst dreams ever since. So, I think food and especially drinks also good enough as one really cant compare with a proper international lounge: Inner Schengen in Europe is more akin to Domestic in the US or Australia and therefore this is more than adequate.

Jul 23, 2024, 5:36 am

Join Date: Sep 2019

Location: TLL

Programs: AY+ Plat (OWE), *A Gold, ST Elite Plus

Posts: 86

I really think the food has gotten worse. Pasta with tomato gunk. Stale bread. Watery mushroom soup with no mushrooms but onions instead. Totally gross. The most appetizing thing was boiled carrots. And they call it platinum corner. Extremely sad.

ffay005 and vulle like this.

Join Date: Mar 2013

Location: Sydney, Australia

Programs: BA Gold, QF Platinum, SQ Silver

Posts: 369

Quote:

Originally Posted by travelmoments

I really think the food has gotten worse. Pasta with tomato gunk. Stale bread. Watery mushroom soup with no mushrooms but onions instead. Totally gross. The most appetizing thing was boiled carrots. And they call it platinum corner. Extremely sad.

Cant get much worse than the awful cod and salmon pasta so this is a big improvement and the Chorizo bits in the pasta actually had some flavour. Mushroom soup was actually quite flavoursome for a packaged soup powder kind of thing.

Again- this is inner European and Finnair does not even offer First class so even just a respite for One World Platinum members (or whatever its called- Diamond?) is better than what most other airlines offer.

Yeah, I was just in AA flagship at DFW and then while waiting plane to board, visited the adjacent AC and Wow what a zoo it was compared to FL (If I would have never been in any lounges, perhaps it would have been quite nice vs waiting in terminal but when one has pinky finger in 1st class world....or the FFP version of such. So, as "domestic" AC equivalent, it can not really be that bad.

I don't agree with the "domestic" explanation at all. European flights are not domestic flights, Schengen or not. Many flights are relatively long, there is no meal service in Y on those flights and many of them cost an arm and a leg, sometimes on par with longhaul flights. No excuse not to serve something edible in the lounge.

I don't agree with the "domestic" explanation at all. European flights are not domestic flights, Schengen or not. No excuse not to serve something edible in the lounge.

Everything in this lounge was perfectly edible. And yes, most inner European flights are significantly shorter than Domestic flights in, say, the US, Australia or China. So indeed, its more akin to Domestic and even the Economy seating in Business class (and lack of meal service in Y which you ironically mention yourself) speak to this simple fact.

Quote:

Originally Posted by ffay005

Okay, so next time I fly from Dili to Darwin on an E170, I'll be on a domestic flight. Good to know. And greetings from Finland to Australia!

Well, most people fly Sydney to Melbourne or Brissy which is indeed a domestic flight. And if Dili is one of those close-by islands that no one typically flies to and therefore gets served by an E170, then youre probably lucky to even get Domestic level service offerings. Not sure what this has to do with flights within the Schengen zone though
